PREFACE

This edition of the Phormio is intended primarily for students who make their first acquaintance with Roman 'comedy by reading the- Phormio. On this account all deviatIons from the classical norm, whether in forms, syntax, or vocabulary, have been explained, and difficult passages translated. The explanatione, however, have been kept within strict limits. Only enough has been given in each case to make the text intelligible to the student. Where further discussion of the points touched on is desirable, it Is best given cicc cccc by the instructor.
